description: 3D arcade flight combat game built with Babylon.js and TypeScript — campaign-driven, browser-based, casual-friendly

userStories.title: Project Bootstrap
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a working Babylon.js + TypeScript project so that I have a foundation to build on.
acceptanceCriteria: Vite + TypeScript project initializes and runs with `npm run dev`
Babylon.js scene renders with camera, light, and a ground plane
A movable cube responds to keyboard input (WASD moves it around)
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Aircraft Entity and Input Manager
userStories.description: As a developer, I need an Aircraft entity class and InputManager abstraction so flight controls have a clean foundation. InputManager must be decoupled from entities (for future multiplayer readiness).
acceptanceCriteria: Aircraft entity class owns a Babylon mesh (placeholder cone/cylinder shape)
InputManager abstraction reads keyboard state (WASD for pitch/roll, QE for yaw, Shift/Ctrl for throttle)
Aircraft reads from InputManager, not directly from keyboard events
Aircraft renders in the scene and responds to input (basic movement, no flight physics yet)
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Arcade Flight Model
userStories.description: As a player, I want to fly an aircraft that feels responsive and fun so that the core moment-to-moment gameplay is satisfying.
acceptanceCriteria: FlightSystem applies velocity-based arcade movement to Aircraft entities
Speed affects turn rate (faster = wider turns)
Stall at low speed: nose drops automatically, speed recovers as aircraft dives — no player input required to recover
Altitude floor prevents flying underground
Debug UI overlay (Babylon GUI or dat.gui) to tweak flight parameters in real-time (sliders for max speed, turn rate, acceleration, stall threshold)
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser: flight feels smooth and responsive at 60 FPS

userStories.title: Camera System
userStories.description: As a player, I want a smooth third-person camera that follows my aircraft so I can see where I'm going and what I'm fighting.
acceptanceCriteria: CameraSystem positions camera behind and slightly above the aircraft
Smooth interpolation — no snapping or jitter during turns
Camera pulls back slightly at high speed, tightens at low speed
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser: camera feels natural during aggressive maneuvering

userStories.title: Terrain and Skybox
userStories.description: As a player, I want to see ground and sky so the world feels real and I have spatial reference.
acceptanceCriteria: Ground plane or basic heightmap terrain with a texture
Skybox with a sky/horizon/ground gradient
Terrain is large enough that the player doesn't fly off the edge in normal gameplay
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser: world feels expansive, no obvious seams

userStories.title: Gun Combat (Projectiles)
userStories.description: As a player, I want to fire guns at enemy aircraft so that I can engage in dogfights.
acceptanceCriteria: Projectile entity class with visible tracer mesh (small elongated shape or line)
WeaponSystem spawns bullet projectiles from the aircraft nose on fire key press
Projectiles travel forward at high speed and despawn after max range or lifetime
Rate of fire is limited (not continuous stream)
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser: gun firing feels punchy with visible tracers

userStories.title: Enemy Aircraft with Basic AI
userStories.description: As a player, I want enemy aircraft that fly and fight so I have something to dogfight against.
acceptanceCriteria: Enemy aircraft entity spawns in the world with a distinct color (red) and flies autonomously using FlightSystem
AISystem implements basic pursuit: fly toward player, attempt to get behind player
Enemy fires guns when player is in front and within range
Enemy takes basic evasive action when being shot at (random turn)
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser: enemy provides a reasonable dogfight challenge

userStories.title: Collision Detection and Damage
userStories.description: As a player, I want projectiles to hit aircraft and deal damage so combat has consequences.
acceptanceCriteria: CollisionSystem detects intersections between projectiles and aircraft (bounding sphere)
Aircraft have a health value; bullets reduce health on hit
Aircraft destroyed at 0 health with explosion VFX (particle burst)
Ground collision destroys the player's aircraft
Player death triggers a simple 'mission failed' state (placeholder — full flow comes later)
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Screen Shake and Hit Feedback
userStories.description: As a player, I want dramatic feedback when I take hits so combat feels impactful.
acceptanceCriteria: Dramatic screen shake on taking damage (heavy shake for big hits, light for small)
Brief red flash or vignette on the screen edge when hit
Explosion particle effect is visible and satisfying when aircraft is destroyed
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser: hits register reliably, screen shake feels punchy

userStories.title: HUD — Flight Instruments
userStories.description: As a player, I want a heads-up display showing flight and combat information so I can make tactical decisions.
acceptanceCriteria: HUD renders using Babylon GUI (AdvancedDynamicTexture), anchored to screen space
Speed indicator (knots or arbitrary units)
Altitude indicator
Heading indicator (compass)
Weapon status (ammo count)
Health/damage indicator
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser: HUD is readable at a glance, doesn't obscure gameplay

userStories.title: Targeting Reticle and Lead Indicator
userStories.description: As a player, I want a targeting reticle so I know where to aim.
acceptanceCriteria: Target reticle highlights the currently selected enemy (bracket or diamond overlay)
Lead indicator shows where to aim guns for deflection shooting
Cycle-target key (Tab or similar) to switch between enemies
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser: reticle and lead indicator make aiming intuitive

userStories.title: Radar Minimap
userStories.description: As a player, I want a radar display so I know where enemies are relative to me.
acceptanceCriteria: 2D top-down radar minimap in a corner of the HUD
Shows relative positions of enemies (red dots) and friendlies (green dots) around a centered player icon
Radar range scales appropriately (not too zoomed in or out)
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser: radar makes it easy to locate enemies

userStories.title: Missile Lock-On System
userStories.description: As a player, I want to lock onto enemies and fire missiles for an alternative to guns.
acceptanceCriteria: Hold lock key while pointing near an enemy to begin lock-on (growing tone/visual indicator)
After lock-on completes, fire key launches a heat-seeking missile
Missile entity tracks the locked target with limited turning ability
Limited missile ammo per sortie
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser: lock-on feels tense, missile tracking is visible

userStories.title: Mission JSON Schema and Loader
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a data-driven mission system so missions can be defined in JSON without recompiling.
acceptanceCriteria: TypeScript interfaces for MissionData (theater, objectives, enemy spawns, player start position)
Mission JSON schema defined; at least one example mission JSON file exists
MissionLoader parses JSON and spawns entities (enemies, player) accordingly
ObjectiveManager tracks objective completion (e.g., 'destroy 3 enemies')
Mission ends when all objectives complete (success) or player dies (failure)
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Briefing Scene
userStories.description: As a player, I want to see a mission briefing before flying so I know what to expect.
acceptanceCriteria: BriefingScene (HTML/CSS overlay or Babylon GUI) shows mission name, description, objectives, and theater
Player presses a key/button to launch into the mission
Scene transitions cleanly to the MissionScene (no flicker)
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser: briefing displays correctly and transitions to gameplay

userStories.title: Debrief Scene and Mission Loop
userStories.description: As a player, I want a debrief after each mission showing results so I get closure on each sortie.
acceptanceCriteria: On mission success or failure: transition to DebriefScene
Debrief shows results: kills, time, pass/fail
Debrief offers 'next mission' or 'return to menu' options
Full loop works: briefing → fly → fight → debrief → menu/next
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser: full loop from briefing through debrief works end-to-end

userStories.title: Aircraft Data (JSON Stats)
userStories.description: As a developer, I need aircraft stats defined in data so the flight model is data-driven.
acceptanceCriteria: aircraft.json defines at least 3 aircraft: F-14 Tomcat, P-51 Mustang, F/A-18 Super Hornet
Each aircraft has distinct stats: max speed, turn rate, acceleration, weapon loadout
FlightSystem reads stats from aircraft data — no hardcoded values per aircraft type
Wide stat spread: P-51 is slow but turns tighter, F/A-18 is balanced, F-14 is fast but less agile
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Hangar Scene (Aircraft Selection)
userStories.description: As a player, I want to choose my aircraft before a mission so I can pick the right tool for the job.
acceptanceCriteria: HangarScene displays available aircraft with their stats (speed, agility, weapons)
Player selects an aircraft; selection carries into the next mission
Locked aircraft shown but not selectable (grayed out)
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser: hangar is navigable and stat differences are clear

userStories.title: Progression and Unlock System
userStories.description: As a player, I want to unlock new aircraft and missions by playing so I feel a sense of progression.
acceptanceCriteria: Completing missions awards a score/rating
New aircraft unlock at campaign milestones (e.g., complete Pacific theater → unlock F/A-18)
Missions unlock sequentially within each theater
Progress persists via localStorage (SaveManager)
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Advanced AI — Formations
userStories.description: As a player, I want enemies that fly in formations so combat feels more realistic and challenging.
acceptanceCriteria: Enemies can fly in wing pairs or diamond formations
Enemies break formation to engage when player is nearby, reform when disengaged
Formation leader determines flight path; wingmen maintain relative positions
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Advanced AI — Evasive Maneuvers
userStories.description: As a player, I want smarter enemies that evade effectively so combat stays challenging throughout the campaign.
acceptanceCriteria: Evasive maneuvers: barrel rolls, split-S, break turns when missiles are incoming
Difficulty scales across campaign (early enemies are dumber, later enemies use advanced maneuvers)
AI difficulty configured per mission in mission JSON
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Weapon Variety — Missiles, Rockets, Bombs
userStories.description: As a player, I want bombs, rockets, and different missile types so missions have tactical variety.
acceptanceCriteria: Heat-seeking missiles (AIM-9 type): lock required, good for dogfights
Radar-guided missiles (AIM-120 type): longer range, fire-and-forget after lock
Unguided rockets: burst fire, good against ground targets
Bombs: drop on ground targets, gravity-affected trajectory
Weapon loadout defined per aircraft in aircraft.json
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser: each weapon type feels distinct

userStories.title: Countermeasures (Flares and Chaff)
userStories.description: As a player, I want to deploy flares and chaff to defeat incoming missiles so I have defensive options.
acceptanceCriteria: Flare key deploys flares (limited supply per sortie)
Flares have a chance to decoy heat-seeking missiles
Chaff has a chance to break radar missile lock
Visible flare/chaff particle effects behind aircraft
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser: deploying countermeasures is visually clear

userStories.title: Ground Targets and SAM Sites
userStories.description: As a player, I want to attack ground targets so there's more than just dogfighting.
acceptanceCriteria: GroundTarget entity class: SAM sites, bunkers, vehicles, radar installations (placeholder meshes)
Ground targets can be destroyed with bombs, rockets, or guns
SAM sites fire surface-to-air missiles at the player
At least one air-to-ground mission JSON exists in the campaign
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser: ground attack gameplay loop works end-to-end

userStories.title: Menu and UI Shell
userStories.description: As a player, I want a main menu to navigate the game's features.
acceptanceCriteria: Main menu (HTML/CSS overlay) with: New Game, Continue, Settings
Settings screen: audio volume slider, graphics quality toggle
Menu transitions cleanly to other scenes (hangar, briefing, etc.)
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser: menu navigation is intuitive

userStories.title: Campaign Theater Selection
userStories.description: As a player, I want to choose between campaign theaters so I can pick my battles.
acceptanceCriteria: Theater/mission select screen showing 4 theaters: Pacific, Middle East, Europe, Arctic
Pacific and Middle East available from start; completing either unlocks Europe; completing Europe unlocks Arctic
Each theater shows completion progress (missions completed / total)
Selecting a theater shows its missions; selecting a mission goes to briefing
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser: theater selection is clear, locked theaters are visually distinct

userStories.title: Save System
userStories.description: As a player, I want my progress saved so I can pick up where I left off.
acceptanceCriteria: SaveManager persists to localStorage: unlocked aircraft, completed missions, scores, unlocked theaters
Save loads automatically on game start — no manual save/load needed
Handles missing or corrupt save gracefully (reset to defaults)
Save data uses a versioned key for future migration
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Campaign Missions — Pacific Theater
userStories.description: As a player, I want 5-8 missions in the Pacific theater to play through.
acceptanceCriteria: 5-8 mission JSON files for Pacific theater
Mix of mission types: tutorial, dogfight, carrier quals
Missions increase in difficulty progressively
Each mission has distinct objectives (not all 'destroy X enemies')
Theater boss encounter as the final mission
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Campaign Missions — Middle East Theater
userStories.description: As a player, I want 5-8 missions in the Middle East theater focused on ground attack.
acceptanceCriteria: 5-8 mission JSON files for Middle East theater
Mix of mission types: ground attack, SAM suppression, precision strike
Desert terrain/skybox palette distinct from Pacific
Theater boss encounter as the final mission
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Campaign Missions — Europe Theater
userStories.description: As a player, I want 5-8 missions in the Europe theater focused on high-altitude intercepts.
acceptanceCriteria: 5-8 mission JSON files for Europe theater
Mix of mission types: high-altitude intercept, stealth/recon, escort
European terrain/skybox palette distinct from other theaters
Theater boss encounter as the final mission
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Scoring and Medals
userStories.description: As a player, I want to be scored and earn medals so I'm motivated to replay missions.
acceptanceCriteria: Mission score calculated from: kills, accuracy, time, damage taken
Medal thresholds: Bronze, Silver, Gold per mission
Medals displayed on debrief scene and in mission select
Best score persisted in save data
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser: medals display correctly on debrief and mission select

userStories.title: Boss Encounters
userStories.description: As a player, I want memorable boss fights at the end of each theater for climactic moments.
acceptanceCriteria: At least one boss per theater (4 total) defined in mission JSON
Bosses have unique behavior patterns (not just tougher enemies — e.g., phases, special attacks)
Boss health bar visible on HUD during boss missions
Defeating boss triggers theater completion and unlocks next theater
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Asset Replacement — Aircraft Models
userStories.description: As a developer, I need to swap placeholder meshes for real GLTF aircraft models.
acceptanceCriteria: At least 3 aircraft have GLTF models loaded via Babylon AssetsManager
Models sourced from CGTrader/Sketchfab/TurboSquid (paid budget available)
Mesh swap is transparent to entity logic (only AssetLoader changes)
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser: real models render correctly and are visually distinguishable

userStories.title: Audio — Engine and Weapons SFX
userStories.description: As a player, I want engine and weapon sounds so the game has audio feedback.
acceptanceCriteria: Engine sound loop per aircraft (pitch varies with throttle via Babylon spatial audio)
Weapon SFX: gun fire, missile launch, explosions
Sounds attenuate with distance for enemies
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Audio — Music Tracks
userStories.description: As a player, I want background music that fits each theater for atmosphere.
acceptanceCriteria: Music tracks per theater (ambient during flight, intensity ramps during combat)
Music volume controllable in settings
Smooth crossfade between ambient and combat music states
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: VFX Polish
userStories.description: As a player, I want polished visual effects so the game looks and feels complete.
acceptanceCriteria: Smoke trails on damaged aircraft
Muzzle flash on gun fire
Missile exhaust trail
Screen shake on hit (already implemented — verify it still works with new VFX)
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser: VFX enhance gameplay without hurting performance

userStories.title: Performance Optimization
userStories.description: As a player, I want the game to run at 60 FPS on mid-range hardware so it's enjoyable to play.
acceptanceCriteria: Object pooling for projectiles and particle effects
LOD on terrain and distant objects
Frustum culling enabled
Profiled with Chrome DevTools — no frame drops below 30 FPS with 20+ entities on screen
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Carrier Model and Flight Deck
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a carrier entity with a flight deck so carrier operations have a physical location.
acceptanceCriteria: Carrier entity with a model (placeholder or real) placed in ocean
Flight deck is a flat collision surface aircraft can land on
Carrier visible from the air as a landmark
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser: carrier renders in the ocean and is identifiable from altitude

userStories.title: Carrier Takeoff and Landing
userStories.description: As a player, I want to take off from and land on aircraft carriers for immersive naval aviation gameplay.
acceptanceCriteria: Catapult takeoff sequence: throttle up → launch from deck
Landing approach with glideslope guidance (HUD shows AoA and lineup indicators)
Arresting wire catch on successful landing (deceleration on deck)
Failed landing = bolter (go around) or crash if too far off
Carrier quals mission in Pacific theater
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser: takeoff and landing feel distinct and rewarding

userStories.title: Arctic Theater and Futuristic Content
userStories.description: As a player, I want the final campaign theater with futuristic aircraft and drone enemies for a climactic endgame.
acceptanceCriteria: Arctic terrain (snow/ice textures, cold palette skybox)
5-8 missions for Arctic theater
Drone swarm enemy type (many weak enemies in coordinated groups)
At least one futuristic/concept aircraft unlockable in this theater
Radar upgrades to rotating sweep display (contacts fade) for futuristic aircraft
Final boss encounter
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Tutorial Mission
userStories.description: As a new player, I want a guided tutorial so I can learn the controls without reading a manual.
acceptanceCriteria: First mission in Pacific theater is a tutorial
Step-by-step prompts on screen: throttle, turn, shoot, lock-on
Forgiving conditions (no enemies until combat tutorial step)
Skippable for returning players (button/key to skip)
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser: tutorial is completable without external instructions

userStories.title: Credits and Final Polish
userStories.description: As a player, I want a credits scene and final polish after completing the campaign.
acceptanceCriteria: Credits scene plays after completing the final Arctic mission
Credits scroll with project attribution
After credits, return to main menu
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser: credits play and return to menu
